children.name: thorugh
children.definition: through by means of a particular method, service, person etc :
examples: She got her first job through an employment agency.

children.name: a success that was achieved through co-operative effort and wise leadership
examples: I heard about it through a friend.

children.name: somehow
children.definition: for some reason that is not clear to you or that you do not understand : không hiểu sao, vì lý do nào đó
examples: Somehow, I just don’t think it’ll work.

children.name: pattern
children.definition: /ˈpætənǁˈpætərn/  the order in which things usually happen or someone usually does something, which you notice because it seems to be regular:
examples: mẫu
▪ Women’s lives used to follow a predictable pattern: school, then marriage and children.
pattern of
mẫu của
▪ Critics of the police say they see a pattern of racism and abuse by officers.
follow a patternhappen in the same way
theo một khuôn mẫu
▪ Police say that each of the murders follows the same pattern.

children.name: systematic
children.definition: /ˌsɪstəˈmætɪk◂/  a systematic way of doing something uses a fixed plan, so that everything gets done thoroughly - use this especially about activities that aredishonestorharmful:
examples: có hệ thống ( đặc biệt là nói về những hành động bất chính )
▪ the systematic destruction of the country’s education system.
Cấu trúc có hệ thống của hệ thống giáo dục quốc gia
▪ Ex-prisoners talked of systematic cruelty within the jail.
Những tù nhân cũ đã nói về sự tra tấn trong ngục
systematically[adverb]một cách có hệ thống
▪ They went through the documents systematically, removing every reference to his former wife.
Họ kiểm tra những tài liệu đó một cách có hệ thống, dở bở mọi tài liệu liên quan tới vợ trước của ông ấy.

children.name: via
children.definition: preposition

children.name: through; using
examples: The London-Addis flight goes via Rome.
Reports are coming in via satellite.
I only found out about it via my sister.

children.name: formula
children.definition: a method or set of principles that you use to solve a problem or to make sure that something is successful :
examples: We’re still searching for a peace formula.
formula for
a formula for the withdrawal of US forces from the area
magic formula(= a method that is certain to be successful)
There is no magic formula that will transform sorrow into happiness.
With viewing figures up a million, the programme has awinning formula.

children.name: way
children.definition: nounPOSSIBILITY

children.name: mode
children.definition: slightly formal a way of operating, living or behaving : cách thức, phương thức, lối
examples: Each department in the company has its own modeofoperation and none of them are compatible.
Railways are the most important modeoftransport for the economy.
For him, painting is just anothermode of expression.
You can choose between several differentmodes of operation.

children.name: the most efficient mode of transportation
examples: Withdrawing a child from class is still the preferred mode of providing extra help to that child.

children.name: actively
children.definition: adverb

children.name: in a way that involves positive action
examples: He's very activelyinvolvedin (= does a lot of work for) the local Labour Party.
It's nice having a man who activelyencouragesme to spend money.
I've been actively looking for a job for six months.

children.name: fast track
children.definition: noun

children.name: the quickest, but usually most competitive, route to success or progress
examples: A degree in computer science offers a fast track to the top.

children.name: basis
children.definition: nounpluralbasesMETHOD

children.name: 2. a way or method of doing something
examples: Most of our staff work for uson a voluntarybasis (= They work without being paid) .

children.name: pattern
children.definition: nounWAY

children.name: whereby
children.definition: by means of which or according to which : bởi đó, nhờ đó

children.name: a proposal whereby EU citizens would be allowed to reside anywhere in the EU
examples: They've set up a plan whereby you can spread the cost over a period.
We need to devise some sort of system whereby people can liaise with each other.

children.name: process
children.definition: noun
examples: 1. a series of actions that you take in order to achieve a result
the peace process
Increasing the number of women in top management jobs will be a slow process.
This decision may delay the processofEuropean unification.
The party has begun thepainful(= difficult) process of rethinking its policies and strategy.
Going to court to obtain compensation is a long process.
She arrived at the correct answer by a processof elimination(= by deciding against each answer that was unlikely to be correct until only one was left) .

children.name: instrument
children.definition: nounTOOL

children.name: 4.formala way of achieving or causing something
examples: He saw the theatre as an instrumentofchange - a way of forcing people to consider social and political issues.

children.name: trick
children.definition: nounMETHOD

children.name: 3. an effective or quick way of doing something
examples: What's the trickofgetting this chair to fold up?
On page 21, twenty tricks to speed up your beauty routine.

children.name: line
children.definition: nounAPPROACH TO SUBJECT

children.name: technique
children.definition: the special way in which you move your body when you are playing music, doing a sport etc, which is difficult to learn and needs a lot of skill →technical: kỳ thuật
examples: He’s a great player, with brilliant technique.

children.name: passport
children.definition: a  tosth

children.name: a certain way of getting something you want
examples: Many students opt for business studies simply because it sounds like a passport to a good job.
Beauty alone can be a passport to success.

children.name: a means to an end
children.definition: something that you do because it will help you to achieve something else
examples: I didn't particularly like the job - it was just a means to an end.

children.name: one way or another
children.definition: 1. in some way that is not stated
examples: Everyone at the party was related (in) one way or another.
one way or another
2. in any way that is possible
These bills have to be paid one way or another.
We have to make a decision one way or another about what needs to be done.

children.name: in a ... manner
children.definition: in a ... way/manner/ɪn ə ... ˈweɪ, ˈmænəʳ/
examples: ▪ She was looking at me in a very strange way.
▪ The wedding ceremony was conducted in quite a formal manner.

children.name: with
children.definition: /wɪð, wɪθ/ với
examples: with enthusiasm/care/envy/delight etc
Với sự nhiệt tình / chăm sóc / ghen tị / vui vẻ vv
▪ A sign warned motorists to drive with care.
Một dấu hiệu cảnh báo người lái xe cẩn trọng.
▪ He has borne his illness with great courage.
Ông đã chịu đựng bệnh tật của mình với lòng can đảm tuyệt vời.
▪ They set about tackling the problem with a great deal of enthusiasm
Họ bắt đầu giải quyết vấn đề rất nhiệt tình.
▪ ‘My daughter’s been selected for the Olympic team,’ she said, with understandable pride.
'Con gái tôi được tuyển vào đội tuyển Olympic,' cô nói với niềm tự hào dễ hiểu.

children.name: like
children.definition: /laɪk/  in a particular way giống như

children.name: :like this/that
examples: ▪ You mustn’t talk to people like that - it’s very rude.
▪ They were all waving their arms around, like this.

children.name: like somebodyin the same way as someone
examples: ▪ He stood bolt upright, like a soldier.
▪ He moves and talks just like his father.

children.name: -style
children.definition: /staɪl/ done or made in a way that is typical of a place, group of people etc - use this after another noun or adjective:kiểu...
examples: ▪ Although he was educated in India, he went to an English-style boarding school.
Mặc dù ông ta được dạy dỗ ở Ấn Độ, ông ta đã học ở một trường nội trú kiểu Anh.
▪ They live in a beautiful little country-style house on the edge of town.
Họ sống trong một ngôi nhà nhỏ xinh theo kiểu nông thôn ở rìa thị trấn.
▪ He wore his gun at the hip, cowboy-style.
Anh ta đeo súng vào hông, phong cách cao bồi.

children.name: along ... lines
children.definition: /əˌlɒŋ ... ˈlaɪnzǁəˌlɔːŋ-/  if something is done along particular lines, it is done in a way that is similar to the way you have mentioned:theo đường lối...
examples: along socialist/military/institutional etc lines
theo đường lối xã hội chủ nghĩa / quân sự / thể chế vv
▪ The school was run along almost military lines.
Trường học được vận hành theo đường lối quân sự.
along the same/similar lines
theo đường lối tương tự
▪ We must have been thinking along the same lines, because we both said together, ‘Let’s get out of here!’
Chúng ta chắc chắn đã suy nghĩ theo cùng một hướng, bởi vì cả hai chúng ta đều nói với nhau: "Chúng ta hãy ra khỏi đây!"

children.name: as if
children.definition: /as though/əz ˈɪf, əz ˈðəʊ/  in a way that seems to show that something has happened, something is true etc, even though this might not always be what has happened, what is true etc:như thể
examples: Dreen looked as if he’d seen a ghost.
▪ She moved her legs slowly, as though in pain.
Cô ta di chuyển chậm rãi như thể đang bị đau.

children.name: with an air of
children.definition: /wɪð ən ˈeər ɒv/  formal in a particular way - used in literature:với vẻ
examples: ▪ The affair had been conducted with an air of mystery which he disliked.
Vụ việc đã được tiến hành với vẻ bí ẩn mà ông không thích.
▪ Lila came out into the yard with an air of happy confidence.
Lila bước ra sân với vẻ tự tin đầy hạnh phúc.

children.name: way
children.definition: a set of actions that you use in order to do something.Wayis more informal thanmethodand is used more often in everyday English :
examples: There are several different ways we can tackle this problem.
way of doing something
Evening classes are one way of meeting new people.
There’s no wayof knowing if the treatment will work.
way to do something
What’s the best way to learn a language?
the way to go about sth
I think you’re going about this in completely the wrong way.
in the same way/in various ways
Make the drink with boiling water in the same way as tea.
Animals communicate in various ways.
(in) the right/wrong way
I think you’regoing aboutthisthe wrong way.
way out/out of/around
One way around the problem(= method of dealing with it )is recycling.
There seems to be no way out of the current economic crisis.
way into television/publishing/finance etc(= a method of getting involved in a particular activity or type of work)
companies eager for a way into business in Europe

children.name: the right way
examples: That’s not the right way to deal with the problem.

children.name: the wrong way
examples: There is a right way and a wrong way to do it.

children.name: a good way
examples: Parent and toddler groups are a good way to meet other mums.

children.name: the best way
examples: Doing the job is often regarded as the best way of learning the job.

children.name: a different way
examples: There are many different ways of borrowing money.

children.name: a sure way
examples: Improving your diet is the surest way to lower your risk of heart disease.

children.name: a quick way
examples: Wouldn’t just asking him be the quickest way to find out?

children.name: an easy way
examples: Here’s an easy way to cut up a mango.

children.name: have a way
examples: Do you have any way of finding out if that is true?

children.name: find a way
examples: We must find a way to help them.

children.name: think of/devise a way
examples: I have to think of a way to make some money.

children.name: method
children.definition: a planned way of doing sth, especially one that a lot of people know about and use :

children.name: use a method
children.definition: alsoemploy a methodformal
examples: Which payment method do you use when travelling?

children.name: adopt a method
children.definition: start using a new method
examples: Quite a few companies adopted Japanese business methods.

children.name: devise a method
children.definition: invent a method
examples: Scientists have devised a method of recycling contaminated oil.

children.name: outline a method
children.definition: describe a method in a few words
examples: This leaflet outlines the methods that are available to you.

children.name: effective/efficient
children.definition: giving the result you want
examples: Some methods are more effective than others.

children.name: reliable
children.definition: likely to give the result you want
examples: We need a more reliable method of predicting earthquakes.

children.name: suitable
examples: No single method is suitable for all occasions.

children.name: a teaching method
examples: Neill had considerable influence over modern teaching methods.

children.name: a farming method
examples: Farming methods have changed a lot over the last 100 years.

children.name: the usual method
examples: The usual method of investing in a company is by buying shares in it.

children.name: the traditional method
children.definition: the usual method
examples: Farmers are being encouraged to return to more traditional methods of farming.

children.name: modern methods
children.definition: methods used now, but not in the past
examples: Modern methods of solving crime depend a lot on forensic evidence.

children.name: the scientific method
children.definition: the usual way of finding out information in science, which involves testing ideas in experiments
examples: It is sometimes difficult to apply the scientific method to subjects such as sociology or psychology.

children.name: an alternative method
children.definition: a method that is different than the usual one
examples: Try to use alternative methods of transport, such as cycling or taking the bus.

children.name: traditional teaching methods
examples: I think we should try again using a different method.

children.name: method of/for (doing) something
examples: Today’s methods of birth control make it possible for a couple to choose whether or not to have a child.

children.name: effective methods for the storage and retrieval of information
examples: RegisterIn everyday English, people usually saya way of doingsomething rather thana method of doingsomething:

children.name: approach
children.definition: a way of dealing with a particular problem or situation, especially a way that has been carefully thought about or planned: hướng tiếp cận
examples: The main advantage of this approach is its simplicity.
approach to
a new approach to teaching languages
He decided toadopt adifferentapproachand teach the Bible through story-telling.
This booktakes anunorthodoxapproachto art criticism.
organizations which take apositive approachto creative thinking

children.name: technique
children.definition: a particular way of doing something, for which you need a skill that has to be learned and practised:

children.name: use a technique
children.definition: alsoemploy a techniqueformal
examples: By using commercial shipbuilding techniques, the Navy hoped to reduce costs.

children.name: devise/develop a technique
examples: Researchers hope to develop more accurate testing techniques.

children.name: learn a technique
examples: We will help the beginner learn these basic techniques.

children.name: practise a technique
examples: Practise your painting techniques on unwanted pieces of wallpaper.

children.name: basic techniques
examples: The girls are taught the basic techniques of childcare.

children.name: modern techniques
examples: Archaeologists now use modern techniques such as aerial photography.

children.name: a simple technique
examples: It is amazing what a difference these simple techniques can make.

children.name: an effective technique
examples: This is an effective technique for removing unwanted hair.

children.name: a standard technique
examples: A sample of blood was obtained from each patient using the standard technique.

children.name: management techniques
examples: He praised their management techniques.

children.name: relaxation techniques
examples: Patients are taught relaxation techniques to use at home.

children.name: surgical techniques
examples: Surgical techniques have improved considerably in the last twenty years.

children.name: technique for
examples: There are various techniques for dealing with industrial pollution.

children.name: technique of
examples: In mathematics, we use many techniques of problem-solving.

children.name: system
children.definition: an organized set of ideas, methods, or ways of working : hệ thống
examples: I do the cooking and Andrew does the shopping; it’s an excellent system.

children.name: effective/efficient
examples: It was a highly effective system of communication.

children.name: inefficient
examples: He described the tax system as inefficient and unfair.

children.name: complex/complicated
examples: The Australian health care system is extremely complex.

children.name: an elaborate system
examples: The proposal has to get through an elaborate system of committees.

children.name: the current/existing system
examples: The current system of taxation is unnecessarily complicated.

children.name: the political/legal/educational etc system
examples: The country is rightly proud of its legal system.

children.name: the economic/banking system
examples: There are fears that the whole banking system could collapse.

children.name: the health care system
examples: The West should be helping these countries to develop modern health care systems.

children.name: develop a system
children.definition: create a new one
examples: The Environment Agency has developed a new national flood warning system.

children.name: introduce a system
children.definition: start to use it
examples: The government has introduced a system of student loans.

children.name: adopt a system
children.definition: decide to use it
examples: They decided to adopt the electoral system used in Britain.

children.name: use/run/operate a system
examples: They use a system of grades to evaluate each hospital’s performance.|We operate a booking system.

children.name: a system operates/works
children.definition: exists and is used
examples: He tried to explain how the planning system operates.

children.name: a system works
children.definition: is successful
examples: The public needs to see that the complaints system works.

children.name: a system breaks down/fails
examples: An alarm sounds a warning before the system breaks down.

children.name: a system collapses
children.definition: fails completely
examples: The European Exchange Rate system collapsed in the 1970s.

children.name: modernize/reform a system
examples: We need to reform the electoral system.

children.name: a system of government/education/justice etc
examples: Why was Britain so slow to develop a national system of education?

children.name: system of/for doing something
examples: We’ve got a good system for dealing with complaints from customers.
I don’t understand your filing system.

children.name: under a system
examples: Under the present system, we do not have any flexibility.

children.name: tactics
children.definition: methods that you use in order to achieve what you want, especially in a game or competition: sách lược

children.name: Salesmen use all sorts of clever tactics to persuade people to buy from them
examples: The team was busy discussing tactics for the game.
He played with the confidence of a winning captain, instinctively changing tactics when necessary.
There were complaints about police tactics used to clear demonstrators.

children.name: the way sb behaves or does sth
way
children.definition: the manner or style in which sb does sth: cách
examples: Losing a job affects different people in different ways.
the way (that) sb does sth
I just love the way she laughs.
I could tell by the way he looked at me that he was annoyed.
Look at the way he’s dressed!
sb’s way of doing sth
The younger girls admired Louise, and tried to copy her way of dressing and talking.
in the same/a different way
We try to treat all the children in the same way
(in) this/that way
I find it easier to work in this way(= like this ).
Sorry, I didn’t know you felt that way(= had that feeling or opinion ).
in a ... way
‘Hello,’ he said in a friendly way.
Maria got up and took a shower in a leisurely way.
that’s no way to do sth(= used to tell someone that they should not be doing something in a particular manner )
That’s no way to speak to your father!
in more ways than one(= in a number of ways )
The changes will benefit the company in more ways than one.
in sb’s (own) way(= in a personal way that other people may not recognize )
I’m sure he does love you, in his own way.

children.name: manner
children.definition: the way that someone behaves towards someone else and talks to them:kiểu
examples: The doctor had a relaxed and friendly manner.
manner of (doing) sth
It seemed rather an odd manner of deciding things.
He felt some guilt over the manner of her death.
in a ... manner
I had hoped you would behave in a more responsible manner.
The issue will be resolved in a manner that is fair to both sides.
criticism ofthe manner in whichthe bishop was appointed
in the usual/normal etc manner
The matter should be submitted to the accounts committee in the usual manner.
not like somebody’s manner
a young man with a slightly shy, awkward manner
RegisterIn everyday English, people usually sayin a ... wayrather thanin a ... manner, or they use an adverb instead:
They behavedin avery reasonableway.
They behaved veryreasonably.

children.name: how
children.definition: somebody does something use this to talk about the way someone behaves or does something:cách ai đó làm cái gì đó
examples: ▪ Have you noticed how she reacts when you mention her husband?
▪ Just watch how he tricks the other player into going in the wrong direction.

children.name: the correct way of doing sth
how to do sth
children.definition: ▪ For details on how to install the program, see the instructions on the right.
examples: show/teach/tell etc sb how to do something
▪Could you show me how to work the photocopier?
▪ My father taught me how to make and mend fishing netsknow
how to do something
▪ I don’t know how to load this thing.
learn/find out/work out etc how to do something
▪ Find out how to decorate your own Easter eggs on pages 30-31.

children.name: procedure
children.definition: the correct or official way of doing something, especially something that has several stages: thủ tục
examples: I want to get a new passport but I don’t know the procedure.

children.name: the correct/proper procedure
examples: What's the correct procedure for applying for a grant?

children.name: normal/standard procedure
examples: It’s standard procedure to take photographs of the scene of the crime.

children.name: a legal procedure
examples: Adoption was not made a legal procedure until 1926.

children.name: a disciplinary procedure
examples: Unacceptable behaviour will be dealt with through our usual disciplinary procedures.

children.name: a complaints procedure
examples: The company has a standard complaints procedure.

children.name: a selection procedure
examples: An interview is an important part of our selection procedure.

children.name: a safety procedure
examples: Apparently the accidents were due to inadequate safety procedures.

children.name: follow a procedure
examples: It’s important that you always follow the correct procedure.

children.name: go through a procedure
examples: We had to go through the whole procedure again.

children.name: procedure for
examples: What’s the procedure for applying for a visa?

children.name: the method you use to achieve sth
means
children.definition: a method, system, machine etc that you use to do sth or achieve sth: phương tiện
examples: We aim to use peaceful means to bring about change.
means of
For most people, the car is still their mainmeans of transport.
the means by which performance is assessed
by means ofusing a particular method or system
He came to power by means of a military coup in 1960.

children.name: an effective/efficient means
examples: Speed bumps are an effective means of stopping cars from going too fast.

children.name: a useful means
examples: Local radio is a useful means of advertising.

children.name: the only means
examples: Then, horses and carts were the only means of transport available.

children.name: the best means
examples: Is this really the best means of achieving our goal?

children.name: an important means
examples: Surveys are an important means of gathering information.

children.name: lawful/legal means
examples: Their protests will continue, but only by legal means.

children.name: unlawful/illegal means
examples: He was accused of attempting to overthrow the government using unlawful means.

children.name: unfair means
examples: Anyone trying to use unfair means in an examination will be reported to the University.

children.name: a means of transportBritish English,a means of transportationAmerican English
children.definition: a way of travelling, for example using a car, bus, bicycle etc
examples: The tram is an efficient means of transport.

children.name: a means of communication
children.definition: a way of talking to someone, for example by phone, writing etc
examples: Newspapers are still an important means of communication.

children.name: a means of expression
children.definition: a way of expressing your feelings or opinions
examples: Music and art are important means of expression.

children.name: a means of identification
children.definition: an official document that shows who you are
examples: Do you have any means of identification?

children.name: the means of production
children.definition: factories and equipment used for producing goods - used especially in Marxism
examples: the class of people which owns the means of production

children.name: the end justifies the means
children.definition: the result you achieve is more important than the way you do it
examples: It’s too bad if people get hurt - the end justifies the means.

children.name: a means to an end
children.definition: something you do only to achieve a result, not because you want to do it or because it is important
examples: Many of the students saw the course as a means to an end: a way of getting a good job.

children.definition: whether
examples: by fair means or foul(= using unfair methods if necessary )They were determined to achieve victory, by fair means or foul.

children.name: have no/any/some means of doing something
examples: There was no path, and they had no means of knowing where they were.

children.name: use any/every means to do something
children.definition: use any method or many methods
examples: He will use any means to get what he wants.

children.name: tool
children.definition: a particular method or system that you use to get a result, especially in business or politics:
examples: Pictures of fleeing refugees were used as an effective propaganda tool against the Communists.
Television is an important tool for the modern teacher.

children.name: tool of
examples: Interest rates are one of the Finance Minister’s main tools of economic policy.
These books arethe tools ofmytrade(= the things I need to do my job ).

children.name: tool for (doing) sth
examples: Dance and aerobics classes are a useful tool for encouraging girls back to school P.E. lessons.

children.name: tactic
children.definition: a carefully planned way of trying to get what you want: sách lược, mưu kế
examples: He’s threatening to sue us? That’s a tactic he’s used before.
Giving out criticism rather than praise is a tactic that rarely works in the workplace.

children.name: a delaying tactic
children.definition: an action which gives you more time
examples: His enemies believed that his sickness was just another delaying tactic.

children.name: scare tactics
children.definition: in which you deliberately try to frighten people
examples: He accused the opposition of scare tactics.

children.name: shock tactics
children.definition: in which you deliberately try to shock people
examples: The charity resorted to shock tactics to try to bring its message home.

children.name: strong-arm tactics
children.definition: the use of force, violence, or threats
examples: Others were furious at what they said were government strong-arm tactics over the vote.

children.name: a diversionary tactic
children.definition: an action which draws attention away from something
examples: Before the attack, nearby areas were bombed as a diversionary tactic.

children.name: underhand/unfair tactics
children.definition: actions which are not fair or honest
examples: I wouldn't stoop to such sneaky, underhand tactics.

children.name: use a tactic
examples: We used various tactics to get their support.

children.name: employ/adopt a tacticformal
children.definition: use a tactic
examples: Many species of fish employ similar defence tactics.

children.name: change/switch tactics
examples: Manchester United switched tactics in the second half.

children.name: resort to a tactic
children.definition: use a tactic because there is no other way to do something
examples: Students resort to these tactics when they see no other way to address the problem.

children.name: a tactic works
children.definition: is successful
examples: Those tactics won’t work with me any more – I know you too well.

children.name: a change of tactics
examples: They trailed 2–1 at half time, but a change of tactics brought a 3–2 win.

children.name: vehicle
children.definition: written formal sth you use as a way of expressing your ideas, communicating sth to people, or achieving what you want: phương tiện
examples: vehicle for (doing) something
▪ the use of TV soap operas as a vehicle for spreading public information
▪ The secret ballot was an important vehicle for freer elections.

children.name: avenue
children.definition: a way of achieving sth - use this especially when there are several different ways and you are trying to find the best one or the only one that is really possible: “đai lộ”
examples: We explored every possible avenue, but still couldn’t come up with a solution.
The president wants toexplore every avenuetowards peace in the region.
There are many avenues open to researchers.

children.name: a way of achieving success, happiness, etc
path
children.definition: / routeC2
examples: ▪ Her political career followed the usual route of local and then national government.

children.name: route/path to
examples: ▪ There’s more than one route to a successful marriage.

children.name: ▪ the path to happiness and enlightenment
the key
children.definition: /ðə ˈkiː/  the most important means of making progress or achieving success:
examples: ▪ In all types of advice work, listening is the key.

children.name: the key to
examples: ▪ What’s the key to getting a good night’s sleep?
▪ We feel that our policy of low-price products in plain packaging is the key to our success.

children.name: secret
children.definition: /ˈsiːkrɪt, ˈsiːkrət/  a way of becoming happy, healthy, successful etc that not everyone knows about or knows how to do:
examples: ▪ I don’t know what her secret is but she always gets top marks in exams.
▪ Hollywood stars reveal their beauty secrets in next month’s edition.

children.name: the secret of somebody’s/something’s success
examples: ▪ Mr. Ritchie, you’re a millionaire at the age of twenty. What’s the secret of your success?

children.name: a dishonest way of getting what you want
ploy
children.definition: /plɔɪ/  a clever way of gaining an advantage, for example by making people feel concerned about you or making them feel grateful towards you:
examples: ▪ The religious element of their election campaign was a cynical ploy.

children.name: ploy to do something
examples: ▪ He’s not really ill, it’s just a ploy to make us feel sorry for him.

children.name: device
children.definition: /dɪˈvaɪs/  something that is intended to achieve a particular aim, especially an aim that is slightly dishonest or unacceptable:

children.name: device to do something
examples: ▪ He used every device possible to prevent inspectors from entering the premises.
▪ Commissions and inquiries are little more than a device to allow politicians to put off taking decisions.

children.name: ways and means
children.definition: clever ways of getting an advantage, especially by doing something that is unusual or secret: cách thức

children.name: ways and means of doing sth
examples: Dealers have ways and means of making people smuggle drugs for them.
There are ways and means of raising the money that we need.
We are discussing ways and means of bringing jobs to our area.

children.name: how
children.definition: /haʊ/  use this to say or ask the way that someone does something:
examples: ▪ How do you get your CD player to work?
▪ We don’t know how she managed to escape.

children.name: how to do something
examples: ▪ My dad’s teaching me how to use email.
▪ She told me how to get to the Johnsons’ house.

children.name: like this
children.definition: /laɪk ˈðɪs/  spoken in this way - say this when you are showing someone the way to do something:
examples: ▪ You have to fold the corners back like this.

children.name: something like this
examples: ▪ The program works something like this.

children.name: somehow
children.definition: if you do sth somehow, you do it by using any method that is available: cách này cách khác, bằng cách nào đó
examples: There’s a bus strike, but I’m sure Ian will get here somehow.
The newspaper had somehow got hold of some secret government papers.
Don’t worry, we’ll get the money back somehow.
Somehow, I managed to lose my keys.

children.name: somehow or other
examples: I’ll find out her address somehow or other.
Maybe we could glue it togethersomehow or other.

children.name: by
children.definition: /baɪ/  using a particular method:

children.name: by doing something
examples: ▪ They got the information by bribing officials.
▪ She earns a living by selling insurance.

children.name: by means of
children.definition: /baɪ ˈmiːnz ɒv/  using a particular method, tool, object etc:
examples: ▪ FBI officers recorded the conversation by means of a tiny bug hidden in the phone.
▪ She paid for the goods by means of a stolen credit card.
